skill.name: git
skill.description: Basic git operations for repository inspection. Use for git diff, git log, git status, git remote, and other read-only git commands.
skill.summary: Basic git operations for repository inspection. Use for git diff, git log, git status, git remote, a...
skill.author: ETeissonniere

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill that provides reference information for git commands. It contains no executable code, scripts, or network capabilities. The skill only documents read-only git commands for repository inspection.

content.user_title: Inspect Git repositories with read-only commands
content.value_statement: Quickly check git repository status without memorizing command syntax. Access essential git inspection commands through simple prompts.

use_cases.title: Check repository status
use_cases.description: Quickly see uncommitted changes, current branch, and repository state before starting work.

use_cases.title: Review change history
use_cases.description: Examine commit history and file changes to understand the evolution of code.

use_cases.title: Track project progress
use_cases.description: Monitor recent commits and development activity without technical git knowledge.

prompt_templates.title: Check status
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me the current git status of this repository

prompt_templates.title: View changes
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me what files have been modified since the last commit

prompt_templates.title: Recent commits
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me the last 10 commits in this repository

prompt_templates.title: Compare branches
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me the differences between main and current branch

output_examples.input: Show me the current git status
output: Your branch is up to date with 'origin/feature/user-auth'.

best_practices: Use --oneline flag for concise commit history
Limit log output with -n flag for better readability
Check current branch before making comparisons
Use --stat for summary view of changes
anti_patterns: Trying to commit or push changes
Ignoring branch context when viewing diffs

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with all git repositories?
faq.answer: Yes, it works with any standard git repository on your local machine.

faq.question: Can I commit changes using this skill?
faq.answer: No, this skill is read-only and cannot modify the repository state.

faq.question: Does it integrate with GitHub or GitLab?
faq.answer: It works with local repositories. Use platform-specific skills for remote operations.

faq.question: Is my repository data safe?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill only reads repository information and doesn't transmit data externally.

faq.question: Why can't I see any output?
faq.answer: Ensure you're in a git repository directory and git is installed on your system.

faq.question: How is this different from using git directly?
faq.answer: It provides the same information through natural language prompts without memorizing commands.
